title: BATMAN - THE DARK KNIGHT 023.1 THE VENTRILOQUIST (2013)
description:
i interrupt this description for one of my weekly rants...

who the hell thinks this new 52 and its redesigns are good? the ventriloquist, while admittedly one of the weaker pre-flashpoint designs, looks like absolute shit! ok a dumpy white guy wearing glasses and a puppet dressed as a 1920s gangster was silly, but who sat there and said "ok let's make this better!" and then drew a white-skinned old lady with saggy boobs, and a puppet that's so generic it should be in the next SAW sequel. fuck this shit. oh, and by the way, flipped through "Desaad" at the comic shop on my lunch hour and asked the clerk to take it out of my purchases. i told him "if the owner has a problem with that, just tell him i said it's misleading to have huntress and power girl on the cover and not in the comic." (he won't care anyway. good guy.)

villains month? bah.

--STF

i now return you to your regularly scheduled description...

------ 

The origin of the Ventriloquist is revealed! One of them has powerful telekinesis and the other is a cold-blooded murderer -- but who's the real dummy in this act?

Written by: Gail Simone
Art by: Derlis Santacruz
Cover by: Patrick Gleason, Mick Gray

Color, 32 Pages
On Sale: September 4, 2013
